die out: If something dies out, it becomes less and less common and eventually disappears completely.
drop out: If someone drops out of college or a race, for example, they leave it without finishing what they started.
ascribe to: If you ascribe an event or condition to a particular cause, you say or consider that it was caused by that thing.
at stake: If something is at stake, it is being risked and might be lost or damaged if you are not successful.
work out: If you work out a solution for a problem, you solve that problem by coming up with that solution.
get along with: If you get along with someone, you have a friendly relationship with them. You can also say that two people get along.
subject to: If an event will take place subject to a condition, it will take place only if that thing happens.
explain away: If someone explains away a mistake or a bad situation they are responsible for, they try to indicate that it is unimportant or that it is not really their fault.
back and forth: If someone moves back and forth, they repeatedly move in one direction and then in the opposite direction.
